etymology.description: 𦉎(𦉎) (wǎng, "net") + 維(維) (wéi, "bird tied with string") = net for catching birds -> 羅(羅) (luó, "net")
etymology.interpretation: The character 羅(羅) (luó) originally depicted a net used for catching birds, combining the symbols for a net and a bird tied with string. This visually represents its function as a bird-catching tool.
etymology.simplification: The simplified form 罗 simplifies 羅 by reducing the complexity of the net component, likely influenced by cursive handwriting styles.

examples.chinese: 渔民撒下罗(漁民撒下羅)，捕到了许多鱼(捕到了許多魚)。
examples.pinyin: Yúmín sā xià luó, bǔ dàole xǔduō yú.
examples.english: The fisherman cast the net, and caught many fish.

examples.chinese: 老渔夫修补罗(老漁夫修補羅)。
examples.english: The old fisherman mended the net.
